meanings.definition: To insert or introduce something into a place or object.
meanings.sent1: She intromitted the key into the lock.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic intromitted the new part into the engine.
meanings.sent3: The magician intromitted a rabbit into the hat, surprising the audience.
meanings.sent4: He intromitted his ideas into the conversation, sparking a lively debate.
meanings.sent5: The chef intromitted the secret ingredient into the recipe, making it delicious.

meanings.definition: To send or transmit something into a place or object.
meanings.sent1: The email intromitted important information to the recipient.
meanings.sent2: The radio waves intromitted signals to the receiver.
meanings.sent3: The bird intromitted a message to its mate using its song.
meanings.sent4: Her smile intromitted warmth into the room.
meanings.sent5: The sun intromitted light into the dark cave, revealing hidden treasures.
